issue.title: When I re export Mixamo's FBX file from Blender,  it unable to apply correctly to VRM.
issue.body:
I used loadMixamoAnimation function to load it.

I created an animation clip using Mixamo 's y-bot and Blender, and exported it to FBX, but  it unable to apply correctly to VRM.
I also tried exporting unmodified Mixamo's animated FBX from Blender, but there is the same issue.
The animation was works well with Three.js with the FBX file itself.

It's need to set some export parameters for FBX?

thx.

pull_request.title: fix (three-vrm-core): Fix expressions material bind to respect alpha
pull_request.body:
will resolve #1301 

This PR fixes an issue that material binds of expression does not respect alpha values.

New optional property for the constructor of `VRMExpressionMaterialColorBind`: `targetAlpha`, which specifies the target alpha.

Alpha only applies to `"color"` type as spec specifies: https://github.com/vrm-c/vrm-specification/blob/master/specification/VRMC_vrm-1.0/expressions.md#materialcolorbind

Points need review:

- [ ] Is this working properly?
- [ ] Let me know if you spot any undesired breaking change

comment.body:
No, we don't have to.
I wondered if we could check if the target alpha == 1 when the bind is for types that doesn't support alpha, but the model, just in case. How do you think?

comment.body: the `if (propertyName == null)` part in the `_initColorBindState` should already do the job if the end developer doesn't do the spicy thing to these materials.

commits.message:
refactor: trivial, put readonly on VRMExpressionMaterialColorBind._propertyNameMapMap

also add a TODO about `satisfies` operator

See: https://github.com/pixiv/three-vrm/pull/1323#discussion_r1374020035

review.body: Didn't find any breaking change and sample works as intended. LGTM.
